head.title: Disc Graphics Net Falls Despite Rise in Revenues

hedline.hl1: Disc Graphics Net Falls Despite Rise in Revenues

abstract.p: Disc Graphics Inc of Hauppauge, NY, reports second-quarter loss of $1.3 million on 6 percent rise in revenue, to $15.6 million; reports six-month loss of $1.8 million and 8.7 percent gain in revenue, to $32.2 million; logo (S)

block.p: Disc Graphics Inc. of Hauppauge (Nasdaq: DSGR), a specialty printing company, reported losses for the second quarter of $1.3 million, or 23 cents a share. For the first six months, losses were $1.8 million, or 33 cents a share.
But revenues for the second quarter rose 6 percent, to $15.6 million, and for the first six months gained 8.7 percent, to $32.2 million.

Disc Graphics Inc. of Hauppauge (Nasdaq: DSGR), a specialty printing company, reported losses for the second quarter of $1.3 million, or 23 cents a share. For the first six months, losses were $1.8 million, or 33 cents a share.
But revenues for the second quarter rose 6 percent, to $15.6 million, and for the first six months gained 8.7 percent, to $32.2 million.

The financial results reflected the continued integration of the business of Contemporary Color Graphics Inc., production inefficiencies associated with an expansion of its Hauppauge plant, increased raw material costs, lower than anticipated sales, and costs associated with quality-control programs.
